name: Technical 19D
text:
Make sure you sign all the warranty paperwork if you buy a DR Horton home, that first year will see half your appliances go out (Chinese junk), probably your heating and/or a/c, etc. Walk the home thoroughly prior to closing because there will be huge gaps in the woodwork, trash left under the carpet padding, cracks in the drywall, the garden tub will need refinished, the granite counters might not even be sealed, and on and on and on...
They are very nice people though and they will fix everything. Mostly it comes down to an inability to find good contractors. We would buy from them again, but would be more cautious.

text: Love my new home!  Plus the one year warranty with DR Horton has been great!  Very responsive to any issues (and the issues have been minor).  Fairhope schools are the best!  The pool is a perfect way to cool off in the summer!

name: Kyle Adams
text: 1.	Our new home was completed 11 months ago. Within 1 month of moving in we noticed some ridging with our floors in several areas the got worse as time went on and we filed a warranty claim. After 10 months and numerous visits from the flooring contractors, DR Horton regional managers, and involving our realtor, escalating the issue as high as possible - talking to an attorney, we were told we mopped our floors too much and our warranty was voided - we use bona once a month or so, and we noticed these issues after a month so were sure this is not the issue. After escalating the issue DR Horton had the flooring manufacturer come out and inspect the floors, which resulted in them telling us they would repair the floors where needed and extend our warranty for 6 months. The flooring rep came out to look at what needed to be repaired and told us they were fairly sure the flooring had been installed before our A/C was installed - and it all needed to be ripped out and it wouldn't be possible to just repair all 12 spots where it was ridging. The regional manager now wants to get another flooring installer to come out since the original one won't repair it. The flooring was obviously not installed correctly and DR Horton is doing whatever possible to delay and not correctly fix the problem. It has been extremely frustrating and definitely makes me wish we had looked elsewhere for a home builder.

text: Had the closing date pushed back literally 5 times and wasn't even told about it until the week of the closing every time. Last time I had to call just to find out it was pushed back again and that was the day before my first walkthroug . Literally the only helpful person in this whole process was Racq Jordan (The Mortgage Officer). He was great with us

name: Deuce Saunders
text:
The sales rep literally just said things to sell the homes. In their advertising and contract they are selling smart homes but there is NO internet and none for the foreseeable future. How can you have a smart home with no internet? Also, they push for their closing dates so the houses are not put together well. They didn't cap things the way they should, our walls are slanted, they intentionally tried to cover shoddy workmanship, and they won't fix it. To top it off, if they do say they'll fix something, they send people that literally say "well I'm no expert, but I'll try". Who does that?
Spend your money elsewhere.

name: Madison Roman
text: Awful communication from start to finish. DR Horton can't get in touch with their contractors to fix things under warranty. They send out people that say things like "I'm not expert" or "this isn't my job, why did they send me?". The cherry on top is no internet in their "smart" homes. So, the street (Chesapeake) was contracted as a smart home, but there is no day in sight when we will have internet, or the other incentives they promised (video doorbell, alexa, echo, $500 in additional smart home technology).

name: Madison Roman
text: DO NOT BUY, NO INTERNET AND NO PLANS FOR INTERNET DESPITE SELLING SMART HOMES

name: Big Ron
text: Well Presented

name: Daniel Frei
text: I have lived in this subdivision for 6years. It is great!

name: Cookie Spears
text: Just another subdivision to clean.

name: Lorin Byrd
text: I love it here! The units are so pretty. I love the colors and furniture, it is very modern. It definitely feels like home. The amenities are great and the staff is eager to help everyone.  I definitely plan on living here again!

name: Katie Wilkinson
text: I have absolutely enjoyed living here. This was my first off campus experience as I lived on campus throughout my undergrad career at a different school. Looking around at other apartments this past summer was difficult but when I called asking about the apartment, the staff was very helpful. When I moved in, I was able to move in early and although there were some issues, they were fixed in a timely manner. For a furnished apartment, the furniture is above and beyond what I was expecting. Whenever I came in with questions, I talked with the Property manager and she was always polite and gave me a timeline for something I needed fixed. For me, the location is perfect - it takes me 5 minutes to get on campus to the one building I use throughout the week. My dad helped me move in and he was also very impressed with the property.

name: lotusman1234
text: I honestly have enjoyed living at the Harbor.  I don't get why some people complain so much about living here.  Honestly my only guess could be they were expecting more luxurious apartments, when let's be real, these are primarily made for college students.  Other than that only real complaint would be the safety concerns at beginning of year, but ever since security has been hired to work there haven't been any problems.

name: Ashleigh Riddle
text: PLEASE!!!!!!!! NEVER live here!! They are very fraudulent. They will sweet talk you into signing a lease but they’re so  conniving and manipulative in the end. The harbor keeps “switching management” so they can get away with telling you one thing at first then switching it so you’ll have to pay even more. They really like to try to get over on students and they are not genuine people. Please never live here. The apartment are okay that’s the only reason why I have them ONE STAR. Other than that they are trash, a bunch of money hungry snakes. The amount of tricks they tried to pull to get more money throughout the year is ridiculous. They wanted us to pay for parking at our apartments then they started towing their own residents and now since they “switched management” all of a sudden I have to pay more rent than I signed up for. like I said they are money hungry, slimy snakes. Stay away!!!

name: Passean Lucas
text: I recently moved in and I must say the Leasing manager Ms. Gaines is amazing. She has a respectable staff and she made my transition to moving in one of the best and smoothest transitions I have ever had . My apartment in my space in general was very clean and ready for me to move in. Honestly I’m so excited and I am already in love with the property. I honestly believe this apartment complex is very well behaved and they are so nice. I got a welcome home gift and it was just a sweet gesture and made me feel like I am actually home 💓

name: Key Ni’Chelle
text: Great staff! Good community. I would 10/10 recommend living here! I definitely plan on living here next year. The units are very modern. The complex is close to campus and is very comfortable for first time students living on their own.

name: Madeline Walcott
text: I’m writing this review because this morning before leaving for class I put in a maintenance request. The second i got home (an hour an a half later) maintenance was knocking on my door to fix the problem... Though you may have heard some negative things about the harbor, I honestly love living here. It may have been a little rocky at first, but they were able to quickly change and adjust (just as any new place should find out). There’s so many great amenities and the staff is super helpful and always available, and the maintenance is great and so quick! I have recommended the harbor to friends before, and will continue to recommend!

name: Anique Ness
text: The power bill is ridiculously high and my two previous apartments never charged me over $50 let alone $100 & I barely be at my apartment. The air does not work and the fact building 3, 4, & 5 does has four floors but no elevator! I stay on the top floor and it’s hard bringing my things and groceries up there not to mention the stairs are concrete and the walls are wooden. The elevator on the deck half work and  has a foul smell. No security really. I really hate the parking and the rules and the fear of my guests and families’ car getting towed. This complex only got one dumpster. The first week i moved here my shower water was too hot. I had no cold water for weeks. There are so many things that needs to be fixed and worked on. It’s not worth living here. My last place did not give me any problems and that place was less pleasant than this place. The landscape is terrible and the stairwells are disgusting!!! The maintenance people are nice but it would be nice if they let us know ahead of time instead of barging in unannounced. One time I just had my under clothes on and they just came in.

name: Christi Hamilton
text: PARENTS DO NOT LET YOUR STUDENT LIVE HERE.  For months we have been attempting to communicate with the company regarding security concerns.  Students have been mugged and even held at gunpoint. There have been empty promises of key fob entries, cameras, and additional lighting but none of the above have actually been installed.  They did hire a security company, but one parent called last night and got voice mail.  Her call was returned 4 hours later.  Meanwhile, her daughter had to call the police as someone was banging on her door in the middle of the night.  The stairwells are littered with trash, both loose as well as large bags, because there is one dumpster for the entire property.  (This is causing quite a rodent and bug infestation.)  It is expensive, UNSAFE and UNCLEAN.  Management pays lip service but accomplishes nothing.  DO NOT SIGN HERE!

name: Annsley Harrison
text: As a new apartment complex they have for sure had to work out some kinks but, overall my experience here has been a good one. I have called the office a few dozen times and they have been helpful and attentive each time. If you are looking for a place to live close to campus I would recommend checking them out!

name: Megan Sparks
text: This apartment complex is extremely overpriced. A cardboard box would be better to live in, and probably more sturdy. My favorite part about living at Harbor on Sixth is being able to listen to my next door neighbor flipping on the light switch to turn the loud bathroom fans on, or maybe being able to hear every word they say. I hope they're feeling better because I've heard them coughing all night! Another great part about living at Harbor is the constant adrenaline I feel from the fear of getting my car towed at any point. Between that and the worry I might get mugged at any point because of the lack of security, every night is an exciting new adventure!! I will give Harbor some credit because they did try and fix terrible parking by adding a whopping 20 guest spots for the hundreds of students that live there. That means each building can have 4 guests!  If you are a friendless loser who enjoys getting no sleep and living in a sloppily made shed, Harbor is the place for you! side note: 100% positive Harbor is faking the nice reviews and/or paying people because I have never met a resident who actually likes living here

name: Nyeesha Underwood
text: I currently live at harbor and I just renewed my lease for another year! I would definitely recommend anyone that is looking for a great community to live here. They have excellent  incentives, and great prices which is one of the reasons why I decided to renew. From the complementary Starbucks coffee, tanning, and a foam mattress!

name: _Trina T
text:
Scams! They reel you in with offers & deals & then have you sign the lease by computer process.  Once its copied out you have a LEASE on file of something totally different from what the associate speaks to you about.  How did we end up on separate leases & with roommates if we completely disagreed to having them. Never would have signed the lease if I had known that.

To anyone that reads this review: Please reconsider HARBOR ON 6TH.

name: Cassandra (Cassie) Rutledge
text: Fantastic place to live! Very spacious bedroom/bathroom/closet! Staff is super friendly and accommodating. Also a very clean place to live, never had any bug or rodent problems!

name: Zaiha Collins
text: parking could be better— there isn’t a big enough parking lot for building 5 residents.. walk from the garage to the end of building five is crucial some days (most days). Flip side: nice size bathrooms, nice amenities, safe area, close to campus, comfortable student living.

name: Robin Cotton
text: This place is unsafe!! My son was robbed at GUNPOINT!!! No cameras!!! And no one will answer or return my phone calls!! Time for lawyers.. as a parent I would not want my child to be here any longer!! And the place is cheaply built for the amount of money they want!!

name: Michaela Howell
text:
Do not recommend living here if you can help it. The location is somewhat inconvenient and the layout is weird, management is also just not that great, rather rude.
But the major cons are:
1. Walls as thin as paper, you can hear everything inside and outside going on around you.
2. No ceiling fans in any room. Your A/C bill will be high, as air gets stagnant and you want it on just to circulate air.
3. Security is poor, never see the night guard patrolling. People are loud at all hours of the night outside and the security does nothing to prevent it. ALL stairwells are open to the outside, anyone can come into the hallways of a building because those doors do not lock and the keypads installed currently are not activated. The cameras don't look active but they may be, took them months to install though, well after people had already moved in. The property is also just not secure, there is one gate for cars but the perimeter as a whole is not secured. It is literally a standalone gate. Anyone can walk onto the property.
4. Open stairwells. Birds frequently get trapped inside on upper floors and die running themselves into windows, unless a passerby catches and releases them. Open stairs also mean bugs in the stairwells, trash left out also does not help this. The levels atop each stair set are carpeted too so that works amazingly for locking in bad smells. Especially when it rains a lot.
5. One dumpster for five buildings = people leaving garbage everywhere
6. No elevators, good luck moving groceries, furniture, boxes, or anything else if you are not on the first floor.

name: Emma Burlingame
text: I absolutely would not recommend leasing with Harbor on 6th. Apartments are livable, but poorly laid out. Furniture is cheap and there's very little cabinet and counter space. Parking is a nightmare. The hallways and stairwells are disgusting because there's trash everywhere, probably due to the fact that the only place to dispose of trash is an inconveniently located trash compactor that's often overflowing. The walls are super thin, so it's constantly noisy. Staff is disorganized and unhelpful. We just got August's electricity bill. It's October. I have yet to be emailed back about anything I've had questions about, and you're just as likely to get sent to voicemail as you are to have the front desk answer. They oversell the amenities. The pool is tiny and the fitness center is a joke. Definitely not worth what they're charging.

name: Emma Burlingame
text: I absolutely would not recommend leasing with Harbor on 6th. Apartments are livable, but poorly laid out. Furniture is cheap and there's very little cabinet and counter space. Parking is a nightmare. The hallways and stairwells are disgusting because there's trash everywhere, probably due to the fact that the only place to dispose of trash is an inconveniently located trash compactor that's often overflowing. The walls are super thin, so it's constantly noisy. Staff is disorganized and unhelpful. We just got August's electricity bill. It's October. I have yet to be emailed back about anything I've had questions about, and you're just as likely to get sent to voicemail as you are to have the front desk answer. They oversell the amenities. The pool is tiny and the fitness center is a joke. Definitely not worth what they're charging.

name: Greg Walker
text: Such a nice place to live. Staff is always so friendly. One of the staff members named Rashad was willing to go above and beyond to help me with my request when first moving in.

name: Luke Floyd
text: I currently live at the Harbor and my experience has been great. I have a river view which is the best view in town! The apartment is brand new and has bamboo, memory foam mattresses, which are amazing. Additionally, all of the furniture is included and is better than what I was expecting. It also includes a smart LG tv in the living room. The kitchen has granite countertops and all new appliances. Good sized bedroom, with large bathroom and walk in closet. The clubhouse is very nice and the staff are all extremely friendly and very helpful. Also, maintenance is very good and responds to my needs very quickly. The apartment has private security that monitors the site during the night, and they are currently installing security cameras and key-fobbed entry on all doors.

name: Falan Hopkins
text: These apartments are really nice with a friendly staff! The amenties here are great. The furniture that is included is very comfortable & the beds have a memory foam mattress! living here has been great for me & my roommates!!

name: Biancia Barrett
text: Have had the worst living experience here. Save your money and sign elsewhere. The fact that you have to pay for parking is the most ridiculous thing I have heard of in Tuscaloosa. Paper thin walls, no elevators, no ventalition in the stair cases, it is all just a mess. There are plenty of apartment complexes that are better than this for cheaper. Honestly, I recommend non-student housing because you don’t deal with major corporations that are only out for money.

name: yanni manolakos
text: I am absolutely disgusted by the way management handles things at harbor on 6th. I’m so excited to move out. I got my car back after it was in Atlanta for 6 months and they towed it even though they promised me I’d be warned and I am a resident. The company they hired also caused thousands of dollars of damage to my car and of Harbor does not compensate me there will be a lawsuit. For the love of god STAY AWAY FROM HARBOR PLEASE!

name: Ed Rutledge
text: It’s bad enough that my daughter is 800 miles away at school but Harbor on 6th took the stress out of her living accommodations.  Clean, safe with the amenities of a 4 star hotel, plus transportation  for the students. Two thumbs up!

name: Sable A. Washington
text: I have had a great experience living at Harbor on 6th. Staff is always available to help whenever assistance is needed. The maintenance team deserves recognition, due to them always being on standby whenever something needed to be fixed throughout the unit.

name: Michael (Patrick) McCarthy
text: The building staff are very abrasive and inexperienced. Harbor on 6th is very good at separating you from your money with so many hidden fees and false promises, this place is sure to leave you frustrated. After this first year of being open as well as the added on fees for anything and everything the prices for all the rooms have gone up even more. The website for the apartments is very slow moving and often does not work. A lot of rules and hidden fees they won't tell you about, so be careful and mistrustful when signing. Always read the fine print here.

name: Joseph Ballard
text: Terrible experience, has changed hands 3 times in the first year. Everything was made cheaply, hit with bogus fees consistently. Do not live here!

name: Rebecca Dikum
text: Extremely expensive for what we received. Management staff is mediocre and take forever to do anything. They are also terrible about notifying residents of anything. FYI the only five star reviews are people who work here. I recognize some of their names.

name: David J Hutchins
text: Staff is amazing... but walls are VERY thin and you can hear every word said by the neighbors above, parking is a huge issue, no pantry, not enough lighting, and there are no security cameras at the moment. Also, even when you're paying $700 for rent, they still try and charge you $10 for parking. Even though its a small fee, the principle of charging residents more just to park at your apartment is absurd.

name: Jacob Harris
text: For what I signed for it is a good deal. However, look elsewhere if you are going to pay over $650 a month. There are plenty of other apartments and subleases with the same amenities if not more that come fully furnished. Management used to be atrocious but they're better now.

name: Nash Stokes
text: Very mixed feelings. Apartment is definitely liveable, but for the price I am not satisfied. The management and the property itself are a mess. Parking is sparse and will likely create a lawsuit soon. Would not pay more than $500/month if I had a do-over.

name: Cassandra Thomason
text: Would not live here again. The staff is able to do nothing but direct you to a member of management at the leasing office who somehow has always gone home for the day, even if you go before noon. There is not a single full sized drawer. The fan in the bathroom turns on automatically with the light and is so loud you can hear it from the living room. No elevator, aside from the (rarely working) one in the parking garage - that you have to pay an extra $10 a month to use, on top of exorbitant rent prices that match standards that are not received. Cable and internet are supposed to be included in the lease, and yet we receive a monthly bill from charter that, after several phone calls and two visits to the leasing office, has not been explained.

name: Patrick McCarthy
text:
Noone is resigning. Besides all the other  things about Harbor, this place is not pet friendly. After paying an over 300 dollar fee to just get your furry friend in the door you are charged monthly, as well as any additional fees harbor sees fit . I am one of two people out of the dozens of dog owners at harbor who actually was forced to pay for my dog, which may show you how unfair and disorganized it is. I also cannot walk my dog around without hearing them giving tours and boasting about how Harbor love dogs. You love dogs huh? Why did one of your employees drag my dog by the back of his neck and make him scream out for help last week? Why also every time I take my dog for a simple walk I have been hassled about rules like no dogs in the sand pit or to put him on a leash. I thought I could get past how expensive this complex has been, as they try to bleed me dry, I also thought I could get past Harbor's fraudulence through their dishonestly about the layout of building 1 in order to convince me to sign, although the building looks nothing like promised. I even thought I could forget the hassle caused by harbor from not being finished until months after I had moved in. I am just so fed up. The only redeeming factor of Harbor on 6th are the personalities of the maintenance staff. I do not know if this place will improve in the future but what I can tell you from present is...Harbor would never receive my business again. Also Harbor stop with the fake 5 star positive reviews, we all know you are writing them. Instead of trying to counteract the testimonies of your residents with your own, I suggest you heed our advice and start making the changes that need to be made to save Harbor from its impending grim fate.
Sincerely,
Former Resident

name: SMTheFlow
text: ...i like basketball, they hace basketball court, diverse residents, and awesome amenities

name: Mitch Laube
text: Thoroughly enjoy my apartment. All the furniture is of great quality and the riverfront view I got lucky to get is awesome!

name: Jamie Bonner
text: Harbor on 6th is a great place to stay, with even more great amenities to offer. Favorite feature is the beautiful club house lounging room and kitchette, oh and the beautiful pool with a lounging area as well. The bedroom and bathroom is huge as well!! Why not stay at the Harbor it’s close to campus with friendly staff!! ⚓️

name: Neoma Long
text: Overpriced sham. Property is not completed and management is unprofessional. Website does not equal reality.

name: Leanna DeCaro
text: Please consider living anywhere other than Harbor on Sixth. Everything here is dirty, disgusting actually. There is no security here whatsoever, we have had 3 robberies in the past 3 months alone. There are bugs and mice all over the place. The walls are SO thin you can hear every word the people who live next to you, below, and above you say, even when they cough. The furniture is cheap and breaking down already even though we are the first ones to use it. Harbor is very deceitful with their advertising, not to mention have people who work for them and their families leave fake "5 star" reviews. I do not have a single positive thing to say about the property or living here. 0/10 would recommend.

name: jamia sneed
text: Very great student apartment complex, the staff makes you feel at home and the apartment model in the leasing office is lovely! Can't wait to move in Fall 2017!

name: David Turner
text: Changed the parking policy after residents had already moved in. They want people to pay an additional $10 to park in the parking deck. The rooms are nice, though.

name: Jesse Scalesi
text: Management has gotten much better recently and any work orders we put in are resolved with a day

name: Douglas Kurczek
text: This is probably the worst managed apartment complex in Tuscaloosa. The management absolutely sucks, they are not helpful, they are slower than molasses in a Chicago winter, and they don't seem to care about their tenants all that much. I take the convenient shuttle to the bus hub nearly every day and one morning got on realizing windows were busted out of it, with plastic over where the glass used to be, WITH GLASS STILL ON THE SEATS. The place honestly doesn't even feel done, my bedroom feels like it only has primer on the walls. Peers of mine did not have all of their appliances, some without fire detectors, STILL. A LOT of corners were cut building this place and it's a shame because it could've been nice. The rates went up by almost $200 for me to renew next year, and I wouldn't be caught dead paying that to stay there again for another inconvenienced and pissed off year.

name: Jamia Sneed
text:
This place sucks. No parking near your building and "reserved/covered" parking applies to a parking deck a mile away from apt since I live at the end. This apartment was put up too fast and VERY VERY VERY poorly thought out.  Building 5 should have been made into two buildings instead of one huge building that takes forever to walk through if you have to park in the deck. Which causes safety concerns as a female working overnights at times. Have not seen any onsite security yet.

Actual apartment is okay though, no real complaints. This parking should have definitely been thought out beforehand. Not worth over $700 monthly. WiFi is reliable

name: James McCollum
text: Over priced, poorly managed, cheaply designed, high crime; overall a very bad value for your money. (Edit: Think critically, a lot of these 5 star reviews are fake. This complex has developed a very bad reputation on campus.) (Update: I have now had my car broken into and my toolbox stolen in their parking deck while their "security" was on duty.)

name: Debbie Jan
text: Brand new complex. Maybe when they work out the kinks. No weekend shuttle for students with no cars. Overcharged for rent and still can't get a refund. If you are trying to get answers, block your phone number or they send you to voicemail.  2 stars just because everything is new, otherwise pass on this place.

name: Brandon Campbell
text: Great place to live comfortable and beautiful area close to campus great office leadership would recommend anyone to live out here come and stay now and you won't regret it!!!!!

name: Madison Flowers
text: AWFUL! Would never, NEVER reccomend this place for anyone to stay! During only 1 semester of it being open it is nearly falling apart, but they are still charging outrageous prices and even trying to raise them! There were also two robberies in a short period of time, after the first that said they would put up cameras but they still hadn’t when the second one happened. Security is a joke. Would not want anyone to live here for safety reasons.

name: Sean Meier
text: I didn’t even want to give this place one star. Doesn’t even deserve it. This is the worlds worst apartment complex. Don’t live here it’s a scam and everyone in the office is always right and the renters are always wrong. The security is horrible and the apartments were built over night. NEVER. LIVE. HERE.

name: Wilson Peter
text: During my time living at the Harbor on 6th, I have had to deal with countless problems and incompetent management. Upon my arrival on the first day, they keys to my apartment would not work. After 2 hours of calls, I finally managed to find a maintenance worker to let me into my apartment. My experiences have only gotten worse since then. The internet is not reliable, the management has disabled my cable without warning, the air conditioner has broken down a couple times, and I have been dealing with the "brand new" refrigerator since the first day (the ice maker does not work, and it has a leaking problem). If you are looking for student housing next year, do not live at the Harbor on 6th.

name: Jessica SInclair
text: Starting on the  4th week of living at Harbor and  so far nothing has gone right. The staff has absolutely no idea what they're doing. The one elevator that we have for the whole complex is in the parking garage and most of the time it's not working. Parking is absolutely atrocious.  My apartment floor was trashed in the middle of night. Trash was everywhere, someone had broken the exit sign, broken glass in the stair well, beer cans everywhere. When I told the staff about this, I was answered with a flippant response of how that's  just what happens on game day weekend...I pay over $700 to live here!!! That's ridiculous.  Living brand new is a complete joke!

name: Joseph Ballard
text: Hate living here. Apartment was made cheaply. Never parking, someone was held at gunpoint and they didn't even tell us.

name: Xiaoyang Liu
text: Nice place with low price, amazing services!

name: Paul Tran
text: Disorganized, apartment complex not ready, staff does not have answers, don't know how they are able to get away with a 4-story building and NO elevators! Very difficult to move in!

name: Thilo Boeckmann
text:
No river view as I'm paying for. Broke cabinets fridge not even plugged up. Have to walk a mile from where I can park in the deck. Scratches all over the "new" cabinets and floor.
No damn pantry

name: Dylan Williams
text: If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. It is a complete dump and the management is both rude and incompetent. Thankfully my roommate and I survived the past year here despite the crime, deplorable living conditions, and cheap appliances. They’ve lowered their rates substantially because no one wants to live here, but you couldn’t even pay me to continue living here.

name: Nate Smith
text: Worst parking model ever, reserved is farther from the apartment and they take all the non reserved spots. Would give 0 stars if I could.

name: Brea Thomas
text: Parking situation sucks

name: slponder
text: Maintenance is very hard working!

name: Jonathan Carroll
text: Best Apartment complex in all of Tuscaloosa.

name: Thomas
text: Awful. Better off living in a tent.

name: Artonious Thomas
text: Great!

name: Rose “ByAnyOtherName” Grace
text: No elevators in 3 of the 5 buildings, no ceiling fans, no pantries, no door to closets, closets can only be accessed by going through the bathroom, kitchen cabinets are a mere 6 inches wide, light in the bathroom is joined with the loud vent in the bathroom so it is impossible to use the restroom in silence. Very disappointing.

name: Nick Bee
text: This facility don’t even deserve 1 star, The property manager who was a African American Woman was so rude to me and my wife, we were potential tenants looking around with a person who was a resident of the apartment complex...she had the nastiest attitude and I wouldn’t advise anyone to let even thier dogs stay here, and I have spoken with a few tenants and they have nothing but bad experiences with the same person STAY AWAY

name: The Real With Aliyah Hill
text: A 4-story building with NO elevators! Moving in was terrible! Limited parking spaces near the buildings! A parking deck that is far away from your building.... unorganized!!!

name: Patrick Nelson
text:
I think the pictures below pretty much speak to the quality you can expect from Woodland.  I've have tried calling their sales office, I was told to call corporate, I called corporate and got voicemail.

My house is about 4 years old.  Well out of warranty.  But, most of the poor workmanship appears after the warranty period has ended.  My master bath and entrance to our master bedroom has severe structural problems.  The cracks you see have been re-plastered and painted more than once.  Forget about doors closing properly.  The doors have been trimmed to such an extent that a new door will be required for the bedroom.  The framing issues you may have will not be covered by your warranty and will not appear until a few years after you own your home.  Once they do, you will find yourself spending a lot of money to repair.

If framing were the only issue, I probably would not write the review.  I never do this kind of thing.  But the electrical was done so poorly that it nearly burned the house down.  The left exposes copper to aluminum high voltage line exposed in a junction box.  The result was blowing out the double oven's control panel.  This resulted in an expensive repair to the ovens, but could have easily resulted in a fire.   Again-- the kind of thing that happens well after your warranty period has expired.

The problem I have with Woodland, is that their "quality" is only skin deep.  They have a great marketing staff, but once your in your house and a year has passed you are on your own to deal with the poor workmanship that lies just below the surface.  No builder is perfect.  But, it would be nice if they built to code.  I have more pictures if you are interested.

name: Joy Wink
text: We love Woodland Home! This is our second home purchase with them. They were professional and very organized through our home building experience. Thank you so much Woodland Homes Team! You are the best!

resp.text: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us!

name: Blake
text:
Let it be known that I’ve given Woodland over a year and a half to make themselves better before writing this review and they have continued to be just as much of a disappointment as they were since the day we closed.

First, don’t let them convince you to close and that your outstanding items will get fixed within 30 days. The sub-contractors don’t keep up with their warranty repairs and Woodland doesn’t follow-up with you after closing unless you are constantly in contact with them. Check my review of Custom Interior Trim to see just how their subs act and treat customers.

Their warranty team is an absolute joke. They don’t follow-up, they don’t coordinate, and if you aren’t keeping them in line, they just let your items slide off the radar.

They have shown a complete lack of professionalism ever since we closed. I will admit, we love the house itself. It’s good quality, the design process was fun, and we felt like the options they had to choose from were exactly in line with what we wanted, but the worst mistake I ever made was trusting that they would continue their great service after having closed on the house. If you don’t listen to anything else, just hear me when I say do NOT let them close on your house until they finish everything. It has truly been bad enough that I regret ever choosing them as a builder, no matter how much we do like the house itself.

And again, if I’m being completely honest, the staff that they have are nice people. I mean I have legitimately enjoyed dealing with most of their staff, but I’ve also had to do their job for them. I have to do all of the follow-up to make sure people are showing up to do their warranty repairs. I’ve had to coordinate with the warranty department and the subs to make sure they had all of the correction items listed.

It’s exhausting dealing with Woodland and their lack of support for Warranty customers. I’ve told them this multiple times, but if they would put just as much care into how they treat and deal with Warranty customers as they do with new customers still in the building process, they would be a nearly flawless business. Until then, they deserve this negative review and more. I’ve spoken with multiple people in my neighborhood who can corroborate this story and would say the same thing themselves. We have warned people we know away from Woodland specifically because of this and away from some of the specific sub contractors they use. Horrible customer service, dismal professionalism, and a demeanor that says “you as a customer don’t matter to us as much as the new build customers.”

resp.text:
Blake,

Thank you for the kind words regarding your home building experience with Woodland Homes. We are happy to hear that you had a fun experience and enjoyed our process of building. Next, we would like to say that we understand your frustrations with warranty. We are in fact struggling with time lines and subcontractors. At this time North Alabama and surrounding areas are experiencing a housing boom. This combined with the struggles of building a product in the midst’s of a global pandemic have made it difficult to obtain products for some of our customers warranty requests.

It is also difficult to keep subs motivated when they have so much work to choose from in front of them. This is just the honest truth, and the reality of the world we are living in.  That said we understand it is frustrating to wait on your items to be completed. While it may take us a little longer to complete a warranty item we are getting to all of our customers and completing their warranty requests. In fact, we have even extended specific warrantable items past the agreed upon 1 year term in order to ensure our customers are happy, and have their items completed .

Since we don’t know your full name there is no way to reach out directly. We would encourage you to call your onsite sales person and get them involved to assist you, or even call our corporate office and ask for the president of the company. He will be happy to work directly with you.

name: Dina Boley
text: Woodland Homes was outstanding building our home!  We loved the out of town service we received when buying from West coast.  The staff helped us every step of the way!  We love our beautiful home.  We couldn’t be happier!

name: Aisha Buycks Realtor (Huntsville Madison AL)
text:
Woodland Homes is a local builder who builds beautiful neighborhoods and homes. They are generally in a nature rich area and provide green spaces within their communities. Most neighborhoods start at mid $300K and go up. There may be a few neighborhoods available at a lower point.

Their process is pretty easy and they are Realtor friendly. Pretty much anything you could want they have the ability to make it happen. You are not limited on your customization as long as you don't price yourself out the neighborhood.

They offer a variety of available styles homes such as garden homes, townhouses, craftsmen bungalows, traditional style homes. Their level of quality in any home they build is generally Executive level. The offer and array of floorplans and amenities within their communities.

If you are in need of someone to assist you while navigating your purchase process with Woodland I am definitely available to help. You can click on my name to acquire my contact.

name: Matt Curtis
text: As an owner of a Woodland Home, Shayne Templet was very helpful in getting us information on our home to help us with a remodel. Thanks Shayne!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!

name: Dominic Simard
text: They built us our dream home!  Love the home, love the people, and love the company! Our 4,650 sqft home is quality.  No major issues.  True luxury home!  Lived in the home for over a year now.

resp.text: Dominic, thank you for letting us know! We are honored to have built your dream home. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do.

name: Cathy Olive
text: Working with Morgan on our house closing was a pleasure. She is very professional and kept us fully informed.  So far we are pleased with the overall craftsmanship and also enjoy the neighborhood.

name: Disappointed Home Buyer
text: The initial phase of the home buying process was great. The personnel in the home office were welcoming and professional. During the build I hired a home inspector who found major errors with the home. This information was relayed to the site manager and many of the errors were overlooked and I’m still dealing with them. Upon walking through my home I found basic issues with the craftsmanship that should’ve been addressed by the site manager, if he had completed a walk thru of the home. Once the home was complete a final walk thru was scheduled. I found the same issues as the last walk thru. At this point, if you don’t address the problem it’s often overlooked. I refused to sign for the keys. As a buyer I felt rushed to sign for the keys to the home, that wasn’t ready. I was promised the issues would be addressed in a timely manner, “I’M STILL WAITING”. I still have a page of outstanding issues with my home. As a premier builder I expected more. The subcontractors provided poor quality of work. No disrespect, but the attention to detail lacked, for my home. I hope no one has to go through what I did. I’m not sure if it’s due to the number of homes Woodland is trying to build or is this the standard issue with Woodland across the board. I didn’t want to come off as a complainer, so I asked around my neighborhood and many of us shared the same problems. This is not to bash Woodland. The homes, cosmetically looks great, I think more effort needs to be made to build a better quality home for the price and oversight of the subcontractors is a must. If this doesn’t happen hold the site manager accountable. The warranty department shouldn’t make people feel like they are the problem. The subcontractors need to do their job and provide a quality product. If I had to do it all again I would definitely ask around the neighborhood where I’m buying and meet one on one with the builder. The company should accommodate, people are spending a lot of money on these homes.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. We pride ourselves in our builders and customer service. If you would please call our office directly, we can address any of your concerns or questions directly. We are sorry to hear this but look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you again.

name: Vinson Moore
text: I have looked at Woodland Homes on Green Mountain, Huntsville Al. It actually defies logic that I could desire so much to live there, be impressed with what I saw, and have the experiences I have had. Maybe it is coincidence but I don’t think so. I will simply state what happened and let the reader decide. I have seriously looked at Woodland homes 4 times. The first experience was positive but I was afraid of the road in and out of the area so I decided not to buy. The last 3 times I had resolved that fear and wanted to purchase a house from Woodland homes. The first of these three, I spoke with an associate. He showed me a lot and gave me a price for a home on the lot. He said we had to see his boss. I did so and she literally panicked. She said he gave me the wrong price. I said ok and left. The second of these 3 times, Woodland homes sent me an email with an advertisement for a house already built. It was priced in the range we were looking for. We made an appointment with the aforementioned realtor and spent 30 minutes looking at the home. It had one feature we did not like but we were about to make an offer when she said oh no, this house has been sold. She added, but we can build you one like it on another lot. We spent a couple of hours looking at lots and found 3 we liked. She said she would send us the prices on all three. The result was that the lot we wanted was not available for the house we wanted to build on it and the other two had prices that were 40 to 50 thousand dollars more than the one we looked at. Not exactly the same price...The last time my wife met with a different realtor and got prices for several models one of which was built and the other almost completed. You have probably guessed what happened. I showed up with the checkbook only to find that all of the homes with quoted prices were much higher than documented on the plans provided to my wife. The one we really wanted was about $70,000 more. The other home already built was about 40,000 dollars more than documented on the plans.We left and will not return. The neighborhood looks great and maybe our experience is some kind of odd anomaly. Just wanted to share it. Good luck.

name: Anthony Shipp
text:
Just had a house built by them, The build to approximately one year due to weather restrictions. But that is not what this is about. The outside of the house is nice and for the most part the inside is ok.

However there are issues with the house that need to be addressed and my mother who has been handling the build for me since I can not be present can not get a hold of anyone. No call backs and no email back.

We are almost certain the HVAC is not connected in the office, the ladder into the attic is not painted or spackled so it is just bare wood, my mother had to paint the trim around the fireplace, and there is a window that still hasn't been installed. The back yard landscaping is terrible, there are so many ruts and holes in the grass that you can barely walk without something to hold onto. The front yard isn't much better.

I could understand a production builder but I would not have expected this from a company that supposed to be a premium builder. The attention to detail is lacking. An expensive production builder.

Update: 28 Jan 2020

Attic stairs still not finished and also realized that the bottom piece of molding is missing from master bathroom window. Also adjacent lots sold to another builder possibly bringing down the property value in existing homes.

I would never recommend building with Woodland and definitely will not consider if I have another home built in the future.

resp.text:
Thank you for your response. We have been in consistent contact with your mom through-out this process. We apologize that communication has been difficult with you since you have been out of country. This is the first we have heard of the HVAC problem, but we have now reported it our warranty department.
It is also not uncommon for a brand new yard of sod to have slight dips after being freshly installed. We are confident that your yard meets warranty guidelines, however, when you return and visit your home we will be happy to look it over again.
Lastly, our records indicate multiple email & phone traffic between the designated POC & the Woodland Homes team.
*Woodland homes appreciates all custom feedback. We are committed to offering a quality home with a one-year warranty in which all terms and conditions are clearly laid out at time of purchase*

name: James Ashbaugh
text: Woodland Homes has made our new home buying experience so seamless, personal, and enjoyable. Thanks to Shanye, John, Rayford, and the whole Woodland Team for all they’ve done to make this transition so great!

name: Tim F
text:
Been in the house as the original owner 6 years, have had multiple issues due to poor subcontractor work.  When a general contractor (Woodland) consistently picks poor subs and refuses to stand behind them, it makes me wonder how they can stay in business as long as they have.

We’ve had plumbing issues with the shower fixtures, roof leaks around the fireplace, and electrical issues with outlets that came loose from the wall.

The most recent is a completely preventable HVAC issue.  The coil sprung a leak after 6 years.  The sub neglected to register the unit, so instead of a 10 year warranty, the manufacturer only gives a five year warranty.  The bill is $2,000 thanks to the sub’s laziness.

Corners were cut at every turn leaving me to wonder what will fail next.  Very disappointed with Woodland, their choice of subs, and lack of accountability.  👎🏻

name: Kim Skaff
text:
Woodland Homes builds a beautiful home on the outside.  However, if you are looking for top quality and attention to detail, you would be better off with another builder. They build homes quickly - maybe too quickly as evidenced by some of the problems we have experienced.  After living in our home for two years, a light switch in our dining room which was not in use at the time suddenly sparked and popped and caused a breaker to blow.  I called an electrician who discovered that the wiring was barely connected which caused arcing and sparking.  He then checked a few more light switches and outlets to find that about half of them were loose and sloppily constructed.  I ended up paying for the electrician to inspect every light switch and electrical plug in my home. I have also had to replace wiring in the electrical box because of a humming noise.
When you build a home with Woodland, they schedule you for a one day marathon of dealing with the contract staff and their design team.  You must be prepared to make ALL decisions in one day.  Their design center has a limited number of choices and you have no time to research products. Don't assume that they offer quality products, either.  Price Pfister products were their plumbing choice at the time I built my home. Huge mistake.  If I had known how crappy this brand was, I would have insisted on Delta products. That goes for wood floors also.  I chose a "premium" product for an additional cost only to find after it started denting and scratching immediately that it was made out of a soft eucalyptus based engineered wood.  I have already replaced half of it with a nice Hickory engineered wood that has held up beautifully- even in high traffic.
I was not happy with either their ceramic tile selection or carpet choices but had no option other than to pick what I disliked the least.  Apparently, most of my neighbors did the same because we all have the same back splash.  I have already replaced carpeting in my bedroom because of poor wear.
This is not the first home that I have had built so it is not like I was expecting perfection.  However, it was expecting better quality than I received.

name: Brandon Harwell
text: i bought my house from the 1st owner so I don't have all the building materials.  I am building a detached garage.  I am trying to match the exterior of my house (brick, shingles, etc).  Trying to get in touch with them for that is impossible.  I called a few years ago to get paint colors so I know they keep records.  Calling now is pretty much a waste of time.  They have a different girl doing it now.  Her voicemail states that it could take up to 24 hours to return call and that email would be quicker.  When I called for brick type it took 3 weeks and I sent an email.  THREE WEEKS!  My fault for forgetting to get shingle type, but now my contractor is ready to shingle my garage.  It has been 24 hours since I left a voicemail.  I have sent 3 emails and left 2 voice mails.

text: Your worker out on the road was driving like an idiot! He was behind me at a stop sign and decided he was going to make the left hand turn at the same time as me and I almost hit him! Then he speeds down Capshaw passing cars in the turning lane.

name: Brandi Burns
text:
BUYER BEWARE!!!! After your one year warranty do not expect them to help out. After being in our house for 2 1/2 years my floors are pulling apart (all of the down stairs I can put quarters between the cracks), I have a leak around my chimney(all the silicone is cracked), our HOA is now going to be responsible for a 400K loan which was used to build a pool and clubhouse (sold as part of the amenity package), the back half of the neighborhood is now front entry garage all because Woodland can and will do these things to make a buck and does not care once you have purchased the house.

After speaking with someone at Woodland about the leak in my Chimney I was told to contact the people they use to install these but Woodland would not pay for it. At this I asked why and was told "if we fix yours and word gets out we will have to fix everyone's". I now have damage in one bedroom and all my insulation is wet.

As for the floors the only response I get is Wolde put those in and from Wolde I get Woodland rushes us to put them in before they can acclimate to the house. What a run around and hassle you do not want to deal with.

text:
Please stay away. I stayed here and was a great tenant; when it was time to leave they told me everything was okay and I was expected to get my deposit back. I was so busy, I didn't check back in to get my deposit and figured ooh well.

It is 7 years later, they took my deposit and reported a huge debt to a credit agency. I may not be able to get a loan on a house because of them.

If you want to be robbed blind by thieves and crooks please stay with Tree Crossings... they will not disappoint.
